Skyway.name: Skyway

classitems.description: Version of Skyway
classitems.name: VERSION

classitems.description:
The list of available regional servers.
- This is for developers to set the nearest region server
  for Skyway to connect to for faster connectivity.
- The available regional servers are:
classitems.name: REGIONAL_SERVER

params.name: APAC1
params.description: Asia pacific server 1.

params.name: US1
params.description: server 1.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtciceconnectionstate-enum).
- This is the RTCIceConnection state of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: ICE_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STARTING
params.description:
The ICE agent is gathering addresses
  and/or waiting for remote candidates to be supplied.

params.name: CHECKING
params.description:
The ICE agent has received remote candidates
  on at least one component, and is checking candidate pairs but has
  not yet found a connection. In addition to checking, it may also
  still be gathering.

params.name: CONNECTED
params.description:
The ICE agent has found a usable connection
  for all components but is still checking other candidate pairs to see
  if there is a better connection. It may also still be gathering.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE agent has finished gathering and
  checking and found a connection for all components.

params.name: FAILED
params.description:
The ICE agent is finished checking all
  candidate pairs and failed to find a connection for at least one
  component.

params.name: DISCONNECTED
params.description:
Liveness checks have failed for one or
  more components. This is more aggressive than "failed", and may
  trigger intermittently (and resolve itself without action) on
  a flaky network.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The ICE agent has shut down and is no
  longer responding to STUN requests.

classitems.description:
The list of peer connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcpeerstate-enum).
- This is the RTCSignalingState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: PEER_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STABLE
params.description:
There is no offer/answer exchange in progress.
  This is also the initial state in which case the local and remote
  descriptions are empty.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_OFFER
params.description:
A local description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_OFFER
params.description:
A remote description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_PRANSWER
params.description:
A remote description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a local description of type "pranswer"
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_PRANSWER
params.description:
A local description of type "offer" has
  been successfully applied and a remote description of type "pranswer"
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description: The connection is closed.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE candidate generation states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcicegatheringstate-enum).
- This is RTCIceGatheringState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: CANDIDATE_GENERATION_STATE

params.name: NEW
params.description:
The object was just created, and no networking
  has occurred yet.

params.name: GATHERING
params.description:
The ICE engine is in the process of gathering
  candidates for this RTCPeerConnection.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE engine has completed gathering. Events
  such as adding a new interface or a new TURN server will cause the
  state to go back to gathering.

classitems.description:
The list of handshake progress steps.
- This are the list of steps for the Skyway peer connection.
- The steps that would occur are:
classitems.name: HANDSHAKE_PROGRESS

params.name: ENTER
params.description: Step 1. Received "enter" from peer.

params.name: WELCOME
params.description: Step 2. Received "welcome" from peer.

params.name: OFFER
params.description: Step 3. Received "offer" from peer.

params.name: ANSWER
params.description: Step 4. Received "answer" from peer.

params.name: ERROR
params.description: Error state.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#idl-def-RTCDataChannelState).
- This is the RTCDataChannelState of the peer.
- <u>ERROR</u> is an additional implemented state by Skyway
  for further error tracking.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE

params.name: CONNECTING
params.description:
The user agent is attempting to establish
  the underlying data transport. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object created with createDataChannel().

params.name: OPEN
params.description:
The underlying data transport is established
  and communication is possible. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object dispatched as a part of a RTCDataChannelEvent.

params.name: CLOSING
params.description:
The procedure to close down the underlying
  data transport has started.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The underlying data transport has been closed
  or could not be established.

params.name: ERROR
params.description: Datachannel has occurred an error.

classitems.description:
The list of signaling actions received.
- These are usually received from the signaling server to warn the user.
- The system action outcomes are:
classitems.name: SYSTEM_ACTION

params.name: WARNING
params.description: Server is warning user that the room is closing.

params.name: REJECT
params.description: Server has rejected user from room.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description: Server has closed the room.

classitems.description:
The list of api server data retrieval state.
- These are the states to inform the state of retrieving the
  information from the api server required to start the peer
  connection or if the browser is eligible to start the peer connection.
- This is the first event that would fired, because Skyway would retrieve
  information from the api server that is required to start the connection.
- Once the state is <u>COMPLETED</u>, Skyway is ready to start the call.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE

params.name: INIT
params.description:
Skyway has just started. No information are
  retrieved yet.

params.name: LOADING
params.description:
Skyway is starting the retrieval of the
  connection information.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
Skyway has completed retrieving the
  connection.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Skyway has occurred an error when
  retrieving the connection information.

classitems.description:
The list of ready state change errors.
- These are the error states from the error object error code.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE_ERROR

params.name: API_INVALID
params.description: Api Key provided does not exist.

params.name: API_DOMAIN_NOT_MATCH
params.description:
Api Key used in domain does
  not match.

params.name: API_CORS_DOMAIN_NOT_MATCH
params.description:
Api Key used in CORS
  domain does not match.

params.name: API_CREDENTIALS_INVALID
params.description:
Api Key credentials does
  not exist.

params.name: API_CREDENTIALS_NOT_MATCH
params.description:
Api Key credentials does not
  match what is expected.

params.name: API_INVALID_PARENT_KEY
params.description:
Api Key does not have a parent
  key nor is a root key.

params.name: API_NOT_ENOUGH_CREDIT
params.description:
Api Key does not have enough
  credits to use.

params.name: API_NOT_ENOUGH_PREPAID_CREDIT
params.description:
Api Key does not have
  enough prepaid credits to use.

params.name: API_FAILED_FINDING_PREPAID_CREDIT
params.description:
Api Key preapid
  payments does not exist.

params.name: API_NO_MEETING_RECORD_FOUND
params.description:
Api Key does not have a
  meeting record at this timing. This occurs when Api Key is a
  static one.

params.name: ROOM_LOCKED
params.description: Room is locked.

params.name: NO_SOCKET_IO
params.description: No socket.io dependency is loaded to use.

params.name: NO_XMLHTTPREQUEST_SUPPORT
params.description:
Browser does not support
  XMLHttpRequest to use.

params.name: NO_WEBRTC_SUPPORT
params.description: Browser does not have WebRTC support.

params.name: NO_PATH
params.description: No path is loaded yet.

params.name: INVALID_XMLHTTPREQUEST_STATUS
params.description:
Invalid XMLHttpRequest
  when retrieving information.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel transfer types.
- This is used to identify if the stream is an upload stream or
  a download stream.
- The available types are:
classitems.name: DATA_TRANSFER_TYPE

params.name: UPLOAD
params.description: The datachannel transfer is an upload stream.

params.name: DOWNLOAD
params.description: The datachannel transfer is a download stream.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel transfer state.
- These are the states to inform the state of the data transfer.
- The list of states would occur are:
classitems.name: DATA_TRANSFER_STATE

params.name: UPLOAD_REQUEST
params.description: Peer has a data transfer request.

params.name: UPLOAD_STARTED
params.description: Data transfer of upload has just started.

params.name: DOWNLOAD_STARTED
params.description:
Data transfer of download has
  just started.

params.name: UPLOADING
params.description: Data upload transfer is occurring.

params.name: DOWNLOADING
params.description: Data download transfer is occurring.

params.name: UPLOAD_COMPLETED
params.description: Data upload transfer has been completed.

params.name: DOWNLOAD_COMPLETED
params.description:
Data download transfer has been
  completed.

params.name: REJECTED
params.description: Peer rejected user's data transfer request.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Data transfer had an error occurred
  when uploading or downloading file.

classitems.description: The list of data transfer data types. - TODO: ArrayBuffer and Blob data transfer in datachannel. - The available data transfer data types are:
classitems.name: DATA_TRANSFER_DATA_TYPE

params.name: BINARY_STRING
params.description: BinaryString data type.

params.name: ARRAY_BUFFER
params.description: Still-implementing. ArrayBuffer data type.

params.name: BLOB
params.description: Still-implementing. Blob data type.

classitems.description:
The list of signaling message types.
- These are the list of available signaling message types expected to
  be received.
- These message types are fixed.
- The available message types are:
classitems.name: SIG_TYPE

params.name: JOIN_ROOM!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description: Send: User request to join the room.

params.name: IN_ROOM!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description: Received: Response from server that user has joined the room.

params.name: ENTER!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: Broadcast message to inform other connected peers in the room
  that the user is the new peer joining the room.
- Received: A peer has just joined the room.
  To send a welcome message.

params.name: WELCOME!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: Respond to user to request peer to create the offer.
- Received: Response from peer that peer acknowledges the user has
  joined the room. To send and create an offer message.

params.name: OFFER!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: Respond to peer's request to create an offer.
- Received: Response from peer's offer message. User to create and
  send an answer message.

params.name: ANSWER!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: Response to peer's offer message.
- Received: Response from peer's answer message.
  Connection is established.

params.name: CANDIDATE!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: User to send the ICE candidate after onicecandidate is called.
- Received: User to add peer's ice candidate in addIceCandidate.

params.name: BYE!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description: Received: Peer has left the room.

params.name: CHAT!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: Deprecated. User sends a chat message.
- Received: Deprecated. Peer sends a chat message to user.

params.name: REDIRECT!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description: Received: Server warning to user.

params.name: ERROR!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description: Received: Deprecated. Server error occurred.

params.name: UPDATE_USER!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: User's custom data is updated and to inform other peers
  of updated custom data.
- Received: Peer's user custom data has changed.

params.name: ROOM_LOCK!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: Room lock action has changed and to inform other peers
  of updated room lock status.
- Received: Room lock status has changed.

params.name: MUTE_VIDEO!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: User has muted video and to inform other peers
  of updated muted video stream status.
- Received: Peer muted video status has changed.

params.name: MUTE_AUDIO!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: User has muted audio and to inform other peers
  of updated muted audio stream status.
- Received: Peer muted audio status has changed.

params.name: PUBLIC_MESSAGE!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: User sends a broadcast message to all peers.
- Received: User receives a peer's broadcast message.

params.name: PRIVATE_MESSAGE!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: User sends a private message to a peer.
- Received: User receives a private message from a peer.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel message types.
- These are the list of available datachannel message types expected to
  be received.
- These message types are fixed.
- The available message types are:
classitems.name: DC_TYPE

params.name: WRQ!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: User request to transfer a data.
- Received: A peer has requested to transfer a data.

params.name: ACK!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: User response to data transfer request.
- Received: Response from peer towards data transfer.
  - -1: Peer has rejected data transfer request.
  - 0: Peer has accepted data transfer request.
  - >0: Data transfer is going on.

params.name: CANCEL!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: User canceled data transfer.
- Received: A peer has canceled data transfer.

params.name: ERROR!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: Timeout waiting for peer response has exceeded limit.
- Received: Response from peer that timeout has reached its limit.
  Data transfer has failed.

params.name: MESSAGE!~YUIDOC_LINE~!-
params.description:
Send: User sends a P2P message.
- Received: A peer has sent a P2P message.

classitems.description:
The list of recommended video resolutions.
- Note that the higher the resolution, the connectivity speed might
  be affected.
- The available video resolutions type are:

params.name: QVGA
params.description: QVGA video resolution.

params.name: VGA
params.description: VGA video resolution.

params.name: HD
params.description: HD video quality

params.name: FHD
params.description: Might not be supported. Full HD video resolution.

classitems.name: VIDEO_RESOLUTION

 signaling server the room has to connect to.

The port that the room

props.name: pcHelper
props.description:
Holder for all the constraints objects used
  in a peerconnection lifetime. Some are initialized by default, some are initialized by
  internal methods, all can be overriden through updateUser. Future APIs will help user
  modifying specific parts (audio only, video only, ...) separately without knowing the
  intricacies of constraints.

props.name: pcConfig
props.description: Will be provided upon connection to a room

classitems.description: Intiailize Skyway to retrieve connection information. - IMPORTANT: Please call this method to load all server information before joining the room or doing anything else. - If you would like to set the start time and duration of the room, you have to generate the credentials. In example 3, we use the [CryptoJS](https://code.google.com/p/crypto-js/) library. - Step 1: Generate the hash. It is created by using the roomname, duration and the timestamp (in ISO String format). - Step 2: Generate the Credentials. It is is generated by converting the hash to a Base64 string and then encoding it to a URI string. - Step 3: Initialize Skyway
classitems.name: init

params.name: options
params.description: Connection options or API Key ID

classitems.description:
Event fired when a data transfer state has changed.
- Note that <u>transferInfo.data</u> sends the blob data, and
  no longer a blob url.

The data transfer state.
  [Rel: Skyway.DATA_TRANSFER_STATE]

params.name: transferId
params.description: TransferId of the data.

params.description:
PeerId of the peer that has a data
  transfer state change.

props.name: percentage
props.description:
The percetange of data being
  uploaded / downloaded.

props.name: data
props.description:
The blob data. See the
  [createObjectURL](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/URL.createObjectURL)
  method on how you can convert the blob to a download link.

params.name: error
params.description: The error object.

props.name: transferType
props.description:
Is error from uploading or downloading.
  [Rel: Skyway.DATA_TRANSFER_TYPE]

classitems.description: Event fired when the signaling server warns the user.

params.description:
The action that is required for
  the user to follow. [Rel: Skyway.SYSTEM_ACTION]

params.name: message
params.description: The reason for the action.

classitems.description: Broadcast a message to all peers. - WARNING: Map arrays data would be lost when stringified in JSON, so refrain from using map arrays.
classitems.name: sendMessage

params.name: message
params.description: The message data to send.

params.name: targetPeerId
params.description:
PeerId of the peer to send a private
  message data to.

classitems.description: Broadcasts to all P2P datachannel messages and sends to a peer only when targetPeerId is provided. - This is ideal for sending strings or json objects lesser than 16KB [as noted in here](http://www.webrtc.org/chrome). - For huge data, please check out function {{#crossLink "Skyway/sendBlobData:method"}}sendBlobData(){{/crossLink}}. - WARNING: Map arrays data would be lost when stringified in JSON, so refrain from using map arrays.
classitems.name: sendP2PMessage

params.name: message
params.description: The message data to send.

params.name: targetPeerId
params.description:
Optional. Provide if you want to send to
  only one peer

classitems.description:
Gets the default webcam and microphone.
- Please do not be confused with the [MediaStreamConstraints](http://dev.w3.
  org/2011/webrtc/editor/archives/20140817/getusermedia.html#dictionary
  -mediastreamconstraints-members) specified in the original w3c specs.
- This is an implemented function for Skyway.
classitems.name: getUserMedia

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. MediaStream constraints.

props.name: stereo
props.description:
Option to enable stereo
   during call.

props.name: resolution
props.description: The resolution of video stream. - Check out VIDEO_RESOLUTION.

classitems.description: Access to user's MediaStream is successful.
classitems.name: _onUserMediaSuccess

params.name: stream
params.description: MediaStream object.

classitems.description: Access to user's MediaStream failed.
classitems.name: _onUserMediaError

params.name: error
params.description: Error object that was thrown.

classitems.description:
Handles everu incoming signaling message received.
- If it's a SIG_TYPE.GROUP message, break them down to single messages
  and let {{#crossLink "Skyway/_processSingleMessage:method"}}
  _processSingleMessage(){{/crossLink}} to handle them.
classitems.name: _processSigMessage

params.name: messageString
params.description: The message object stringified received.

classitems.description: Handles the single signaling message received.
classitems.name: _processingSingleMessage

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received.

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends a redirect message.
- SIG_TYPE: REDIRECT
- This occurs when the signaling server is warning us or wanting
  to move us out when the peer sends too much messages at the
  same tme.
classitems.name: _redirectHandler

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received.

props.name: url
props.description: Deprecated. Url to redirect user to.

props.name: action
props.description:
The action to work on.
  [Rel: Skyway.SYSTEM_ACTION]

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends a updateUserEvent message.
- SIG_TYPE: UPDATE_USER
- This occurs when a peer's custom user data is updated.
classitems.name: _updateUserEventHandler

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received.

props.name: mid
props.description:
PeerId of the peer that is sending the
  updated event.

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends a roomLockEvent message.

props.name: mid

PeerId of the peer that is sending the
  updated room lock status.

props.name: lock
props.description: If room is locked or not.

- SIG_TYPE: MUTE_AUDIO

  status has changed.

props.name: mid
props.description:
PeerId of the peer that is sending
  their own updated audio stream status.

props.name: muted
props.description: If audio stream is muted or not.

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends a muteVideoEvent message.
- SIG_TYPE: MUTE_VIDEO

  status has changed.

params.description: The message object received.

props.name: mid
props.description:
PeerId of the peer that is sending
  their own updated video streams status.

props.name: muted
props.description: If video stream is muted or not.

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends a bye message.
- SIG_TYPE: BYE
- This occurs when a peer left the room.
classitems.name: _byeHandler

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received.

props.name: mid
props.description: PeerId of the peer that has left the room.

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends a privateMessage message.
- SIG_TYPE: PRIVATE_MESSAGE
- This occurs when a peer sends private message to user.
classitems.name: _privateMessageHandler

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received.

props.name: mid
props.description:
PeerId of the peer that is sending a private
  broadcast message.

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends a publicMessage message.
- SIG_TYPE: PUBLIC_MESSAGE
- This occurs when a peer broadcasts a public message to
  all connected peers.
classitems.name: _publicMessageHandler

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received.

props.name: mid
props.description:
PeerId of the peer that is sending a private
  broadcast message.

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends an inRoom message.
- SIG_TYPE: IN_ROOM
- This occurs the user has joined the room.
classitems.name: _inRoomHandler

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received.

props.name: mid
props.description:
PeerId of the peer that is
  sending the joinRoom message.

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends a enter message.
- SIG_TYPE: ENTER
- This occurs when a peer just entered the room.
- If we don't have a connection with the peer, send a welcome.
classitems.name: _enterHandler

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received.

props.name: mid
props.description: PeerId of the peer that is sending the enter shake.

props.name: mediaStatus.audioMuted
props.description: If peer's audio stream is muted.

props.name: mediaStatus.videoMuted
props.description: If peer's video stream is muted.

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends a welcome message.
- SIG_TYPE: WELCOME
- This occurs when we've just received a welcome.
- If there is no existing connection with this peer,
  create one, then set the remotedescription and answer.
classitems.name: _welcomeHandler

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received.

props.name: mid
props.description: PeerId of the peer that is sending the welcome shake.

props.name: enableIceTrickle
props.description: Option to enable Ice trickle or not

props.name: enableDataChannel
props.description: Option to enable DataChannel or not

props.name: mediaStatus.audioMuted
props.description: If Peer's Audio stream is muted.

props.name: mediaStatus.videoMuted
props.description: If Peer's Video stream is muted.

props.name: target
props.description: PeerId of the peer targeted to receieve this message.

props.name: hsPriority
props.description: The priority of the user to send first.

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends an offer message.
- SIG_TYPE: OFFER
- This occurs when we've just received an offer.
- If there is no existing connection with this peer, create one,
  then set the remotedescription and answer.
classitems.name: _offerHandler

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received.

props.name: mid
props.description: PeerId of the peer that is sending the offer shake.

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends a candidate message.
- SIG_TYPE: CANDIDATE
- This occurs when a peer sends an ice candidate.
classitems.name: _candidateHandler

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received.

props.name: mid
props.description:
PeerId of the peer that is sending the
  offer shake.

props.name: target
props.description:
PeerId that is specifically
  targeted to receive the message.

classitems.description:
Signaling server sends an answer message.
- SIG_TYPE: ANSWER
- This occurs when a peer sends an answer message is received.
classitems.name: _answerHandler

params.name: message.type
params.description: Message type

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received.

props.name: mid
props.description: PeerId of the peer that is sending the enter shake.

classitems.description:
Actually clean the peerconnection and trigger an event.
Can be called by _byHandler and leaveRoom.
classitems.name: _removePeer

params.name: peerId
params.description: PeerId of the peer that has left.

classitems.description:
We have succesfully received an offer and set it locally. This function will take care
of cerating and sendng the corresponding answer. Handshake step 4.
classitems.name: _doAnswer

params.name: targetMid
params.description: PeerId of the peer to send answer to.

classitems.description:
We have a peer, this creates a peerconnection object to handle the call.
if we are the initiator, we then starts the O/A handshake.
classitems.name: _openPeer

params.name: targetMid
params.description: PeerId of the peer we should connect to.

params.name: peerBrowser
params.description: The peer browser information.

params.name: toOffer
params.description: Wether we should start the O/A or wait.

params.name: receiveOnly
params.description: Should they only receive?

classitems.description:
Sends our Local MediaStream to other Peers.
By default, it sends all it's other stream
classitems.name: _addLocalStream

params.name: peerId
params.description: PeerId of the peer to send local stream to.

classitems.description:
The remote peer advertised streams, that we are forwarding to the app. This is part
of the peerConnection's addRemoteDescription() API's callback.
classitems.name: _onRemoteStreamAdded

params.name: targetMid
params.description: PeerId of the peer that has remote stream to send.

params.name: event
params.description: This is provided directly by the peerconnection API.

classitems.description: It then sends it to the peer. Handshake step 3 (offer) or 4 (answer)
classitems.name: _doCall

params.name: targetMid
params.description: PeerId of the peer to send offer to.

params.name: peerBrowser
params.description: The peer browser information.

classitems.description:
Finds a line in the SDP and returns it.
- To set the value to the line, add an additional parameter to the method.
classitems.name: _findSDPLine

params.name: sdpLines
params.description: Sdp received.

params.name: condition
params.description: The conditions.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to set Sdplines to

return.description: [index, line] - Returns the sdpLines based on the condition

classitems.description:
Adds stereo feature to the SDP.
- This requires OPUS to be enabled in the SDP or it will not work.
classitems.name: _addStereo

params.name: sdpLines
params.description: Sdp received.

classitems.description: Set Audio, Video and Data Bitrate in SDP
classitems.name: _setSDPBitrate

params.name: sdpLines
params.description: Sdp received.

return.description: Updated version with custom Bandwidth settings

classitems.description:
This takes an offer or an aswer generated locally and set it in the peerconnection
it then sends it to the peer. Handshake step 3 (offer) or 4 (answer)
classitems.name: _setLocalAndSendMessage

params.name: targetMid
params.description: PeerId of the peer to send offer/answer to.

params.name: sessionDescription
params.description:
This should be provided by the peerconnection API.
  User might 'tamper' with it, but then , the setLocal may fail.

classitems.description: Sets the STUN server specially for Firefox for ICE Connection.
classitems.name: _setFirefoxIceServers

params.name: config
params.description: Ice configuration servers url object.

classitems.description:
Waits for MediaStream.
- Once the stream is loaded, callback is called
- If there's not a need for stream, callback is called
classitems.name: _waitForMediaStream

params.name: callback
params.description: Callback after requested constraints are loaded.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. Media Constraints.

classitems.description: Opens or closes existing MediaStreams.
classitems.name: _setStreams

return.description: Whether we should re-fetch mediaStreams or not

classitems.description:
Creates a peerconnection to communicate with the peer whose ID is 'targetMid'.
All the peerconnection callbacks are set up here. This is a quite central piece.
classitems.name: _createPeerConnection

classitems.description:
A candidate has just been generated (ICE gathering) and will be sent to the peer.
Part of connection establishment.
classitems.name: _onIceCandidate

params.name: event
params.description: This is provided directly by the peerconnection API.

classitems.description:
Sends a message to the signaling server.
- Not to be confused with method
  {{#crossLink "Skyway/sendMessage:method"}}sendMessage(){{/crossLink}}
  that broadcasts messages. This is for sending socket messages.
classitems.name: _sendMessage

classitems.description: Initiate a socket signaling connection.
classitems.name: _openChannel

classitems.description: Closes the socket signaling connection.
classitems.name: _closeChannel

classitems.description: Create a DataChannel. Only SCTPDataChannel support
classitems.name: _createDataChannel

params.name: peerId
params.description: PeerId of the peer which the datachannel is connected to

params.name: dc
params.description: The datachannel object received.

classitems.description: Sends data to the datachannel.
classitems.name: _sendDataChannel

params.name: peerId

params.name: data
params.description: The data to send.

classitems.description: Handles all datachannel protocol events.
classitems.name: _dataChannelHandler

params.name: data
params.description: The data received from datachannel.

classitems.description:
The user receives a blob request.
From here, it's up to the user to accept or reject it

params.name: peerId
params.description: PeerId of the peer that is sending the request.

params.name: data
params.description: The data object received from datachannel.

props.name: chunkSize
props.description: The data chunk size expected to receive.

props.name: timeout
props.description: The timeout to wait for packet response.

classitems.description: The user receives an acknowledge of the blob request.
classitems.name: _dataChannelACKHandler

params.name: peerId
params.description: PeerId of the peer that is sending the acknowledgement.

params.name: data
params.description: The data object received from datachannel.

props.name: ackN
props.description:
The acknowledge request number.
- 0: Request accepted. First packet sent.
- 0 and above: Transfer is going on.
- -1: Request rejected.

classitems.description: The user receives a datachannel broadcast message.
classitems.name: _dataChannelMESSAGEHandler

props.description: Is the error occurring at upload state.

classitems.name: _dataChannelERRORHandler

params.name: peerId
params.description: PeerId of the peer that is sending the error.

params.name: data
params.description: The data object received from datachannel.

classitems.name: _dataChannelDATAHandler

params.name: dataString

The data type received from datachannel.
  [Rel: Skyway.DATA_TRANSFER_DATA_TYPE]

PeerId of the peer that is expected to receive
  the request response.

The response of the user to accept the data
  transfer or not.

params.name: peerId

PeerId of the peer that is expected to receive
  the request response.

params.name: transferType

classitems.description:
Sets the datachannel timeout.
- If timeout is met, it will send the 'ERROR' message
classitems.name: _setDataChannelTimeout

params.name: peerId
params.description: PeerId of the datachannel to set timeout.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The timeout to set in seconds.

params.name: isSender
params.description: Is peer the sender or the receiver?

classitems.description: Clears the datachannel timeout.
classitems.name: _clearDataChannelTimeout

params.name: peerId
params.description: PeerId of the datachannel to clear timeout.

params.name: isSender
params.description: Is peer the sender or the receiver?

params.name: self
params.description: Skyway object.

classitems.description:
Converts base64 string to raw binary data.
- Doesn't handle URLEncoded DataURIs
- See StackOverflow answer #6850276 for code that does this
This is to convert the base64 binary string to a blob
classitems.author: Code from devnull69 @ stackoverflow.com
classitems.name: _base64ToBlob

params.name: dataURL
params.description: Blob base64 dataurl.

classitems.description: Chunks blob data into chunks.
classitems.name: _chunkFile

params.name: blob
params.description: The blob data to chunk.

params.name: blobByteSize
params.description: The blob data size.

classitems.description:
Start a data transfer with peer(s).
- Note that peers have the option to download or reject receiving the blob data.
- This method is ideal for sending files.
- To send a private file to a peer, input the peerId after the
  data information.
classitems.name: sendBlobData

params.name: data
params.description: The data to be sent over. Data has to be a blob.

params.name: dataInfo
params.description: The data information.

props.name: timeout
props.description:
The timeout to wait for packets.
  [Default is 60].

params.name: targetPeerId
params.description:
PeerId targeted to receive data.
  Leave blank to send to all peers.

classitems.name: _sendBlobDataToPeer

params.name: data
params.description: The blob data to be sent over.

params.name: dataInfo
params.description: The data information.

props.name: timeout
props.description:
Data timeout to wait for packets.
  [Default is 60].

params.name: targetPeerId
params.description:
PeerId targeted to receive data.
  Leave blank to send to all peers.

classitems.name: _handleAV

params.name: mediaType
params.description:
Media types expected to receive.
  [Rel: 'audio' or 'video']

params.name: enableMedia
params.description: Enable it or disable it

classitems.description: Lock the room to prevent peers from joining the room.
classitems.name: lockRoom

classitems.description: Unlock the room to allow peers to join the room.
classitems.name: unlockRoom

classitems.description:
Enable microphone.
- If microphone is not enabled from the beginning, user would have to reinitate the
  {{#crossLink "Skyway/joinRoom:method"}}joinRoom(){{/crossLink}}
  process and ask for microphone again.
classitems.name: enableAudio

classitems.description:
Disable microphone.
- If microphone is not enabled from the beginning, there is no effect.
classitems.name: disableAudio

classitems.description:
Enable webcam video.
- If webcam is not enabled from the beginning, user would have to reinitate the
  {{#crossLink "Skyway/joinRoom:method"}}joinRoom(){{/crossLink}}
  process and ask for webcam again.
classitems.name: enableVideo

classitems.description:
Disable webcam video.
- If webcam is not enabled from the beginning, there is no effect.
- Note that in a Chrome-to-chrome session, each party's peer audio
  may appear muted in when the audio is muted.
- You may follow up the bug on [here](https://github.com/Temasys/SkywayJS/issues/14).
classitems.name: disableVideo

classitems.description: Parse stream settings
classitems.name: _parseStreamSettings

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. Media Constraints.

classitems.description: User to join the room. - You may call {{#crossLink "Skyway/getUserMedia:method"}} getUserMedia(){{/crossLink}} first if you want to get MediaStream and joining Room seperately. - If joinRoom() parameters is empty, it simply uses any previous media or user data settings. - If no room is specified, user would be joining the default room.
classitems.name: joinRoom

params.name: room
params.description: Optional. Room to join user in.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. Media Constraints.

props.name: stereo
props.description:
Option to enable stereo
   during call.

props.name: resolution
props.description:
The resolution of video stream.
  [Rel: Skyway.VIDEO_RESOLUTION]

props.name: audio
props.description:
Audio stream bandwidth in kbps.
- Recommended: 50 kbps.

props.name: video
props.description:
Video stream bandwidth in kbps.
- Recommended: 256 kbps.

props.name: data
props.description:
Data stream bandwidth in kbps.
- Recommended: 1638400 kbps.

classitems.description: User to leave the room.
classitems.name: leaveRoom

warnings.message:
